Class HighScoreManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.HighScoreManager
public class HighScoreManager extends Object
Manages high scores and leaderboards for different game modes.

This class handles persistent storage of player scores across game sessions, maintaining separate leaderboards for Classic and Time Attack modes. Scores are stored in text files and automatically sorted in descending order.

Functionality:

  • Loads and saves scores from persistent storage
  • Maintains top 10 scores for each game mode
  • Provides quick access to high scores
  • Automatically sorts scores in descending order

  • Method Details

    • loadScores

      public List<Integer> loadScores(HighScoreManager.GameMode mode)
      Loads all scores for the specified game mode from persistent storage.
      Parameters:
      mode - the game mode to load scores for
      Returns:
      a list of all saved scores, empty list if no scores exist or file cannot be read

    • saveScores

      public void saveScores(HighScoreManager.GameMode mode, List<Integer> scores)
      Saves the score list to persistent storage for the specified game mode.
      Parameters:
      mode - the game mode to save scores for
      scores - the list of scores to save

    • addScore

      public void addScore(HighScoreManager.GameMode mode, int score)
      Adds a new score to the leaderboard for the specified game mode.

      The score is automatically inserted into the sorted leaderboard. If the leaderboard exceeds 10 entries, the lowest score is removed.

      Parameters:
      mode - the game mode to add the score to
      score - the score value to add

    • loadHighScore

      public int loadHighScore(HighScoreManager.GameMode mode)
      Retrieves the highest score for the specified game mode.
      Parameters:
      mode - the game mode to get the high score for
      Returns:
      the highest score, or 0 if no scores exist

    • loadHighScore

      public int loadHighScore()
      Retrieves the highest score for Classic mode.

      This is a convenience method equivalent to calling loadHighScore(GameMode) with GameMode.CLASSIC.

      Returns:
      the highest score in Classic mode, or 0 if no scores exist

    • getTopScores

      public List<Integer> getTopScores(HighScoreManager.GameMode mode, int count)
      Retrieves the top scores for the specified game mode.
      Parameters:
      mode - the game mode to get scores for
      count - the maximum number of scores to retrieve
      Returns:
      a list of the top scores in descending order, may contain fewer than count elements if fewer scores are available
